gurmukhi: duAwds joDy kiRSn ky Aiq blbMf AKMf ] jIq lXo hY jgq ijn bl kir Bujw pRcMf ]1401]
transliteration: Duaadas Jodhe Krishan Ke At(i) Balband Akhannd|| Jeet Layo Hai Jagad Jin Bal Kar(i) Bhujaa Prachanndd||1401||
translation: Twelve warriors of Krishna are extremely powerful, who have conquered the whole world with their strength.1401.

gurmukhi: bwlm isMG mhwNmiq isMG jgwjq isMG ley As DwXo ] isMG DnyS kiRpwvq isMG su jobn isMG mhwN br pwXo ]
transliteration: Baalanm Singh Mahaanmat(i) Singh Jagadjat Singh Lae As Dhaayo|| Singh Dhanesh Kridaavat Singh Su Joban Singh Mahaan Bar Paayo||
translation: Balram Singh, Mahamati Singh and Jagajat Singh, fell upon him (the enemy) with their swords; Dhanesh Singh, Kripavat Singh, Joban Singh,

gurmukhi: jIvn isMG clXo jg isMG sdw isMG lY js isMG rswXo ] bIrm isMG ley SkqI kr mY KVgyS so ju`Du mcwXo ]1402]
transliteration: Jeevan Singh Chadyo Jag Singh Sadaa Singh Lai Jas Singh Rasaayo|| Bderan Singh Lae Shaktikar Mai Khadgesh So Juddh(u) Machadyo||1402||
translation: Jiwan Singh, Jag Singh, Sada Singh etc. also marched forward; taking his Shakti (digger) in his hand, Viram Singh, began the war with Kharag Singh.1402.

gurmukhi: mohn isMG ijh nwm Bt soaU BXo iqn sMig ] SsqR Dwr kir mY lIey swjXo kvc inKMg ]1403]
transliteration: Mohan Singh Jih Naam Bhat Sooo Bado Tin San(i) Shastra Dhaar Kar(i) Mai Leee Saajyo Kavach Nikhan||1403||
translation: A warrior named Mohan Singh accompanied him; he was carrying his weapons n his hands and was decorated with the quiver and armour.1403.

gurmukhi: KVgyS blI khu sXwm BnY sB BUpn bwn pHwr krXo hY ] TwFo rhXo diRV BUp ry myr so Awhv qy nhI nYku frXo hY ]
transliteration: Khadgesh Balikauh Syaam Bhanai Sah Bhoopan Baan Prahaar Daryo Hai|| Thaadho Rahyo Drid Bhoop Re Mer So Aahav Te Nahinaik(u) Daryo Hai||
translation: All the kings struck their blows on the mighty warrior Kharag Singh with their arrows, but he remained firm in the battlefield like a mountain without fear;

gurmukhi: kop bFI iqh Awnn aUpr qw Cib ko kib Bwau DrXo hY ] rois kI Awg pRcMf BeI sr puMj Cuty mwno GIau prXo hY ]1404]
transliteration: Kop Badhitih Aanan Oopar Taa Chhab(i) Ko Kab(i) Bhaao Ddaryo Hai|| Ros(i) Kiaag Prachanndd Bhaisar Pounj Chhoute Maano Gheeo Daryo Hai||1404||
translation: The anger seemed greatly increased on his face and in the powerful fire of his anger, these arrows worked like ghee.1404.

gurmukhi: jo dl ho hir bIrin ky sMg so qo kCU Air mwir lXo hY ] Pyr AXoDn mY rup kY As lY ijX mY pun kop BXo hY ]
transliteration: Jo Dal Ho Har(i) Bderan(i) Ke San So To Kachhodh Ar(i) Daar(i) Layo Hai|| Pher Ayodhan Mai Roup Kai As Lai Jiya Mai Poun Kop Bhayo Hai||
translation: Krishna’ s force of warriors that was there, some of the warriors from it were knocked down by the enemy; he stood furiously again in the field, taking his sword in his hand;

gurmukhi: mwr ibdwr dXo Gt gXo dl so kib ky mn Bwau nXo hY ] mwnhu sUr pRlY ko cVXo jl swgr ko sB sUk gXo hY ]1405]
transliteration: Maar Bidaar Dayo Ghat Gyo Dal So Kabi Ke Man Bhaao Nayo Hai|| Maanoh Soor Pralai Ko Chadyo Jal Saagad Ko Sabh Sook Gado Hai||1405||
translation: By killing the enemy’s army, he decreased it like waters of the ocean dried up by the blazing sun on doomsday.1405.

gurmukhi: piRQmy iqnkI Buj kwit deI iPr ky iqn ky isr kwit dey ] rQ bwjn sUq smyq sBY kib sXwm khY rn bIc Cey ]
transliteration: Prithame Tinkibhuj Kaattee Daiphir Ke Tin Ke Sir Kaattee Dae|| Rath Baajan Soot Samet Sabhai Kabi Syaam Kahai Ran Beech Chhae||
translation: In the first place, he chopped the arms of the warriors and then their heads; the chariots alongwith the horses and the charioteers were destroyed in the battlefield;
